message.content:
We need to “build up” the Interest Receivable balance from all the “Interest Receivables”–type transactions. In our “new problem” the opening (initial) balance does not include any interest‐related entry (only initial “Cash deposit”, “Bank deposit” and “Fixed Assets” appear with no “Interest” type). Therefore we assume that at the very start the Interest Receivable balance is zero. Then, we “post” all the Interest entries – each one “adds” to the receivable (all are “Unpaid” as is typical for accruals).

Below are the “Interest Receivables” rows (with the amount field taken from the “amount” column):

1. Interest20240101001: 441.44  
2. Interest20240102002: 441.44  
3. Interest20240103003: 441.44  
4. Interest20240104004: 435.21  
5. Interest20240105005: 435.21  
6. Interest20240106006: 435.21  
7. Interest20240107007: 435.21  
8. Interest20240108008: 435.21  
9. Interest20240109009: 435.21  
10. Interest20240110010: 435.21  
11. Interest20240111011: 435.21  
12. Interest20240112012: 435.21  
13. Interest20240113013: 435.21  
14. Interest20240114014: 435.21  
15. Interest20240115015: 435.21  
16. Interest20240116016: 435.21  
17. Interest20240117017: 435.21  
18. Interest20240118018: 406.57652662  
19. Interest20240119019: 406.57652662  
20. Interest20240120020: 384.32652662  
21. Interest20240121021: 384.32652662  
22. Interest20240122022: 339.82652662  
23. Interest20240123023: 339.82652662  
24. Interest20240124024: 339.82652662  
25. Interest20240125025: 339.82652662  
26. Interest20240126026: 339.82652662  
27. Interest20240127027: 336.26652662  
28. Interest20240128028: 311.72566573  
29. Interest20240129029: 5.75345573  
30. Interest20240130030: 14.65345573  

A quick “step‐sum” (here we show one way to break up the addition):

• The first three rows: 3 × 441.44 = 1324.32  
• Then rows 4–17 (14 rows at 435.21 each): 14 × 435.21 = 6092.94  
  Sum so far = 1324.32 + 6092.94 = 7417.26  
• Rows 18–19: 2 × 406.57652662 ≈ 813.15305; adding gives 7417.26 + 813.15 = 8230.41  
• Rows 20–21: 2 × 384.32652662 ≈ 768.65; new sum = 8230.41 + 768.65 = 8999.06  
• Rows 22–27: Five rows at 339.82652662 (5×339.82652662 = 1699.13) plus one row at 336.26652662 gives 1699.13 + 336.27 = 2035.40; new sum = 8999.06 + 2035.40 = 11034.46  
• Row 28: +311.73 → 11034.46 + 311.73 = 11346.19  
• Row 29: +5.75 → 11346.19 + 5.75 = 11351.94  
• Row 30: +14.65 → 11351.94 + 14.65 = 11366.59 (≈11366.60)

Thus, since there was no initial balance (assumed zero) and the “new” accumulated total of all interest transactions is about 11,366.60, the answer is as follows:

{
  "solution": {
    "Interest Receivable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Interest Receivable End Value": "11366.60"
  }
}

This answer is reached by summing each “Interest Receivables” transaction in the period, and noting that no prior (initial) interest balance was recorded.
